intro: Schradera monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed schradera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive single terminal flower head, which is surrounded by specialized leaves called bracts. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Schradera monocephala is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
